an3.13:1.1: “These three individuals are found in the world.
an3.13:1.3: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
an3.13:1.4: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless individual?
an3.13:1.5: It’s when an individual is reborn in a low family—a family of corpse-workers, bamboo-workers, hunters, chariot-makers, or scavengers—poor, with little to eat or drink, where life is tough, and food and shelter are hard to find.
an3.13:1.6: And they’re ugly, unsightly, deformed, sickly—one-eyed, crippled, lame, or half-paralyzed. They don’t get to have food, drink, clothes, and vehicles; garlands, fragrances, and makeup; or bed, house, and lighting.
an3.13:1.8: ‘They say the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:1.10: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:1.11: This is called a hopeless individual.
an3.13:2.1: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful individual?
an3.13:2.2: It’s when someone is the eldest son of an anointed aristocratic king. He has not yet been anointed, but is eligible, and has been confirmed in the succession.
an3.13:2.4: ‘They say that the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:2.6: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:2.7: This is called a hopeful individual.
an3.13:3.1: And what, mendicants, is an individual who has done away with hope?
an3.13:3.2: It’s when a king has been anointed.
an3.13:3.4: ‘They say that the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:3.6: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:3.8: Because the former hope he had to be anointed has now died down.
an3.13:3.9: This is called an individual who has done away with hope.
an3.13:3.10: These are the three individuals found in the world.
an3.13:4.1: In the same way, these three individuals are found among the mendicants.
an3.13:4.3: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
an3.13:4.4: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless individual?
an3.13:4.5: It’s when an individual is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, festering, and depraved.
an3.13:4.7: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:4.9: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:4.10: This is called a hopeless individual.
an3.13:5.1: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful individual?
an3.13:5.2: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, of good character.
an3.13:5.4: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:5.6: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:5.7: This is called a hopeful individual.
an3.13:6.1: And what, mendicants, is an individual who has done away with hope?
an3.13:6.2: It’s when a mendicant is a perfected one, who has ended all defilements.
an3.13:6.4: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:6.6: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an3.13:6.8: Because the former hope they had to be freed has now died down.
an3.13:6.9: This is called an individual who has done away with hope.
an3.13:6.10: These are the three individuals found among the mendicants.”
